DOC.brief_summary: In study , infants previously vaccinate hepatitis B vaccine birth randomly allocate two group : - one group subject receive diphtheria , tetanus , acellular pertussis- hepatitis B virus-inactivated poliovirus/Haemophilus influenzae type b ( DTPa-HBV-IPV/Hib ) vaccine 6-10-14 week age - second group subject receive DTPa-HBV-IPV/Hib vaccine 2-4-6 month age
DOC.brief_title: Immunogenicity & Safety GSK 's Combined DTPa-HBV-IPV/Hib Vaccine Indian Infants 2 Diff Vaccination Schedules
DOC.detailed_description: DTPa-HBV-IPV/Hib vaccine administer two schedule ( i.e . 6-10-14 week age OR 2-4-6 month age ) infants previously vaccinate hepatitis B vaccine birth . The duration study approximately 3 month subject receive vaccination 6-10-14 week age approximately 5 month subject receive vaccination 2-4-6 month age . Intervention name : Diphteria , tetanus , acellular pertussis , hepatitis B , poliovirus type 1 , 2 , 3 & Haemophilus influenzae type b vaccine
DOC.criteria: A healthy male female infant , include , 6 10 week age time first vaccination . Written inform consent obtain parent guardian subject . Born normal gestation period ( 36 42 week ) . Should receive birth dose hepatitis B vaccine , evidence vaccination/immunisation certificate . Use investigational nonregistered product ( vaccine drug ) study vaccine within 30 day precede first dose study vaccine , plan use study period . Chronic administration ( defined 14 day ) immunosuppressant immunemodifying drug prior first vaccine dose . Any chronic drug therapy continue study period . Planned administration/administration vaccine foreseen study protocol period start 30 day administration first vaccine dose end 30 day last dose ( exception oral polio vaccine birth dose pulse polio program , per local , regional , national requirement ) . Previous vaccination diphtheria , tetanus , pertussis , poliomyelitis Haemophilus influenzae type b disease . Known exposure diphtheria , tetanus , Bordetella pertussis , hepatitis B , poliomyelitis Haemophilus influenzae type b disease since birth .
